preprocessor module¶

src.preprocessor.clean_text(x)¶

[Function for cleaning text and removing characters, user identification, and non-printable characters that can interfere with the model’s ability to make accurate predictions.]

Parameters

x ([string]) – [A string unprocessed string with characters to be removed.]

Returns

[Cleaned version of the string.]

Return type

[string]

src.preprocessor.normalize_comment(comment)¶

[Does a variety of normalizing steps, such as separating punctuation and decensoring, before splitting words within a sentence into a list of words.]

Parameters

comment ([string]) – [A string]

Returns

[cleaned version of string, which helps reveal toxic words]

Return type

[string]

src.preprocessor.split_word(word, toxic_words)¶

[Function that accounts for toxic words being hidden within normal text. If any of the toxic words are found, it will split the non-toxic text, exposing the toxic word.]

Parameters

  • word ([string]) – [A string containing a toxic word.]

  • toxic_words ([strings]) – [List of toxic words.]

Returns

[Toxic word.]

Return type

[string]

src.preprocessor.word_tokenize(sentence)¶

[Function that tokenizes text and replaces associated characters with letters as well as adds spaces around punctuation.]

Parameters

sentence ([string]) – [A string.]

Returns

[List of strings. Each component of the sentence as its own string.]

Return type

[List]
